verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David. A Song.) There will be silence <S%H1747><s%> before Thee, [and] praise <S%H8416><s%> in Zion, <S%H6726><s%> O God; <S%H430><s%> And to Thee the vow <S%H5088><s%> will be performed. <S%H9608><s%>
O Thou who dost hear <S%H8085><s%> prayer, <S%H8605><s%> To Thee all <S%H3605><s%> men <S%H1320><s%> come. <S%H935><s%>
Iniquities <S%H5771><s%> prevail <S%H1396><s%> against <S%H4480><s%> me; As for our transgressions, <S%H6588><s%> Thou dost forgive <S%H3722><s%> them.

How blessed <S%H835><s%> is the one whom Thou dost choose, <S%H977><s%> and bring <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> [to Thee], To dwell <S%H7931><s%> in Thy courts. <S%H2691><s%> We will be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with the goodness <S%H2898><s%> of Thy house, <S%H1004><s%> Thy holy <S%H6918><s%> temple. <S%H1964><s%>

By awesome <S%H3372><s%> [deeds] Thou dost answer <S%H6030><s%> us in righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> O God <S%H430><s%> of our salvation, <S%H3468><s%> Thou who <S%H4009><s%> art the trust <S%H4009><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the ends <S%H7099><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> and of the farthest <S%H7350><s%> sea; <S%H3220><s%>
Who dost establish <S%H3559><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> by His strength, <S%H3581><s%> Being girded <S%H247><s%> with might; <S%H1369><s%>
Who dost still <S%H7623><s%> the roaring <S%H7588><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> The roaring <S%H7588><s%> of their waves, <S%H1530><s%> And the tumult <S%H1995><s%> of the peoples. <S%H3816><s%>

And they who dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the ends <S%H7117><s%> [of the earth] stand <S%H3372><s%> in awe <S%H3372><s%> of Thy signs; <S%H226><s%> Thou dost make the dawn <S%H1242><s%> and the sunset <S%H6153><s%> shout <S%H7442><s%> for joy. <S%H7442><s%>

Thou dost visit <S%H6485><s%> the earth, <S%H776><s%> and cause it to overflow; <S%H7783><s%> Thou dost greatly <S%H7227><s%> enrich <S%H6238><s%> it; The stream <S%H6388><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> is full <S%H4390><s%> of water; <S%H4325><s%> Thou dost prepare <S%H3559><s%> their grain, <S%H1715><s%> for thus <S%H3651><s%> Thou dost prepare <S%H3559><s%> the earth.

Thou dost water <S%H7301><s%> its furrows <S%H8525><s%> abundantly; <S%H7301><s%> Thou dost settle <S%H5181><s%> its ridges; <S%H1417><s%> Thou dost soften <S%H4127><s%> it with showers; <S%H7241><s%> Thou dost bless <S%H1288><s%> its growth. <S%H6780><s%>
Thou hast crowned <S%H5849><s%> the year <S%H8141><s%> with Thy bounty, <S%H9186><s%> And Thy paths <S%H4570><s%> drip <S%H7491><s%> [with] fatness. <S%H1880><s%>
The pastures <S%H4999><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> drip, <S%H7491><s%> And the hills <S%H1389><s%> gird <S%H2296><s%> themselves with rejoicing. <S%H1524><s%>

The meadows <S%H9221><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with flocks, <S%H6629><s%> And the valleys <S%H6010><s%> are covered <S%H9400><s%> with grain; <S%H1250><s%> They shout <S%H7321><s%> for joy, <S%H7321><s%> yes, <S%H637><s%> they sing. <S%H7891><s%>
